newsitem.title: JAPAN: NTT foreign procurement progressing - Japan minister.
newsitem.headline: NTT foreign procurement progressing - Japan minister.

text.p: Overseas procurements by Japan's Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp (NTT) are progressing steadily, Posts and Telecommunications Minister Hisao Horinouchi was quoted as saying on Tuesday.
"Procurements are progressing steadily. I don't know what the U.S. is upset about," a ministry official quoted him as saying.
On Monday, the U.S. Trade Representative's Office released a report which said trade barriers thwart U.S. sales abroad.
U.S. Trade Representative Charlene Barshefsky in a statement accompanying the report specifically pointed to problems concerning NTT.

"Despite recent progress with procurement among some Japanese government agencies, I am particularly concerned that the results U.S. companies have achieved with NTT compared with the private Japanese telecommunications sector suggest NTT is still captive to its monopoly legacy and not fully responsive to market principles," she said.
